reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Embassy Suites is currently undergoing renovations. It will be very nice when it is finished but is a little distracting with the noise now. One morning we opened our door to workmen outside with materials stacked up in front of our door and they were pulling electrical wire in the ceiling.
reviews.title: I'd stay here again

likes.liked: — The furniture in the living room area

reviews.title: nice accomodations, customer service could be better
reviews.text: The cooked to order breakfast was good - especially enjoyed their omelets. Then we were able to enjoy breakfast by their little waterfall. Nice!
The Manager's Reception offers free drinks and snacks - nachos, pretzels, etc. Not bad for free. The bartender looks forward to a tip.
reviews.title: one night only

reviews.text: There is a Omaha Steakhouse and it is the only restaurant at the hotel. The food was excellent but was a little pricey.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: They have a free shuttle to and from the airport which was appreciated. After reading a former review about cars being broken into we decided to utilize the free shuttle and not risk the rental car.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!!

reviews.text: Stayed at this Embassy Suites over a weekend. i forgot what the Embassy suites are like during that time period.
reviews.title: not for a weekend getaway

likes.disliked: — paper thin walls and lack of help from the front desk

reviews.title: SUPER STAY!
reviews.text: This Embassy Suites was well kept. It is clean, and the front desk people are easy to work with. They have a nice reception at night, and the people working it even know how to make a Long Island Ice Tea. Can't tell you if it's any good or not as I just drink beer. Small work-out room, but they have three treadmill machines, some free weights, as well as a cable machine. A nice amenity. The pool are is well kept also.

They have the standard cook-to-order breakfast that Embassy suites are known for, but in apparent anticipation of a large amount of guests that night (Saturday), they had a side buffet ready to go on Sunday morning as well. It had a separate, small line, where you could get eggs, meat, potatoes, biscuits, rather than wait in a rather large line (9:00 am). Nice touch by the management.
reviews.title: An oasis in a sea of awful holiday travel
Hotel = 8 - Free Wi-Fi = 0
reviews.text: The room are typical of an Embassy Suite, and the bedroom walls are paper thin (which is also a trademark of theirs). Which again is typical of the ES construction. About 3:00 am, I was awakenend by the people next door who were "on a roll". Not only did the chatter go on, but everyone needed a shower. I called the front desk about 3:30 am, and they said they would send up security. Nothing happened. I called again about 4:15 am, and the front desk said that they would call and give a "final warning" or words to that effect. It didn't work. The hotel does have some sort of security as they like to drive around the parking lot with their green lights flashing, but I don't think they are allowed into the hotel. And in fairness to them, it is hard to reason with a bunch of drunks at 4:00 in the morning. About 5:00 am, the party finally died. I complained to the front desk the next morning. I had checked in for 3 nights, but after 2 hights, I was done. They were polite enough to comp the room for the second night. It's partially my fault, as after all of these years of traveling, I should know better than to check into an Embassy Suites for the weekend.

reviews.title: More Positives Then Negatives
reviews.text: Had a great stay here. The atrium is nice, with lots of seating areas available, amid the plantings, fountains, and birds. The breakfast was great. The manager reception in the afternoon was very generous and an enjoyable way to relax at the end of the day. It is not near downtown, but takes about 5 minutes to drive there. My room was clean and updated. I always like the larger suites at this chain, and for me that makes staying a bit of a drive from downtown worth it. This hotel gets booked up early. I will definitely stay here again.

A few years ago when my children were younger, I used to worry about staying in a "nice" hotel because the kids might stain the carpet or upholstery or break/chip something else. No need to worry here. Chances are that whatever it is, it's already been stained, chipped or broken at least once.
reviews.title: A Deteriorating, but passable, Airport Hotel

likes.liked: — Brevity of stay; proximity to airport
likes.disliked: — Excessive war and tear in room

reviews.text: We all know the Embassy Suites formula. An atrium with large 2-room suites all around the perimiter. The rooms have one or two beds in the bedroom, a living room with a sleeper couch and a pseudo-kitchenette with a wet bar, fridge and microwave. Full breakfast in the morning and a "manager's reception" at the better ones in the evening. Personally, I love the formula for both business and personal travel, but from time to time once needs to renovate. It's time here.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed overnight with my family recently because of Useless Airways' inability to make connecting flights connect, so all I saw were the rooms (we had three in total) and the breakfast. Bottom line -- Breakfast good. Rooms, not so much. Each of the rooms were relatively clean (an unemptied waste basket in one gave me pause), but "well lived in." In other words, I wouldn't lie naked on top of the bedspread, not even on a dare.
reviews.title: Will never stay again

reviews.text: Partially compensating for the rooms, the staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Both the night and morning front desk managers went out of their way to soothe the stress of nine very aggravated travelers. As well, the morning shuttle driver went above and beyond the call of duty.
reviews.title: would not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paid $119 per night as a "distressed traveler," which is alright for a business rate. Travelling on my own nickel, however, I would not pay more than $89 for a room, and only if the Holiday Inn Express were booked solid.
reviews.title: Have always enjoyed my visits

likes.disliked: — Less parking due to the 2 weddings that weekend

reviews.text: I was in town for 5 days/4 nights. Great rooms, very clean, love the separate living room and bedroom. The warm breakfast in the AM was good with eggs made fresh to order. And the happy hour in the evening was perfect. I did use the gym and the business center, both were adequate. The Omaha Steakhouse on site was very good and convenient. Would highly recommend this place to business travelers. Close to the Interstate and only a few miles from Uptown.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

likes.liked: — Full Breakfast in AM, Free Happy Hour, Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and again this year. The rooms are clean and it is nice that there are two separate rooms where you can close the door between them. I didn't really look like anything had been done with this hotel since we left 2 years ago other than the business center went from 3 computers in a room to 1 computer in the hall way. We were there with a large group and it was nice to be able to meet with other group members for breakfast. The managers reception was nice with nachos and drinks but it is busy! A friends car was broken into in the parking lot and the video cameras did not pick up enough detail to help. Of course, this is not the hotels fault and cannot be prevented anywhere. It is not really located close to any nice eating place although they do have a nice and rather expensive restaurant on property where we did not eat. Others in our group ate there and said it was good. Overall the experience was okay but I would stay elsewhere if I had the choice next time as it was more expensive than other places close just as nice.
reviews.title: Rooms were clean

reviews.text: Great stay. My friend and I are teachers and on occasions we get the kids together and set off to a new destination. The hotel appears to be fairly new. We had a great 2 bedroom suite with the living area separating the rooms.
reviews.title: Great Stay Spring Break 08'

reviews.text: The breakfast and manager's reception is one of the best that we have experienced because they offered fresh spinach and mushrooms as an omelette choice for breakfast and a variety of snacks in the evening including Jordan almonds, cinammon- coated pecans, Mike and Ikes and more.
reviews.title: Relaxing place after a long road trip for business

likes.disliked: — Having to set up a reservation through the house phone to get a last minute room.

reviews.text: Convenient to downtown and other attractions like Carowinds. Concord outlets and popular chain restaurants are on same strip which includes a Bass Pro shop... an extra "attraction" for the kids.
reviews.title: Surprisingly bad experience for an Embassy Suites
